QAPair.Question: What is (are) Methemoglobinemia - acquired ?
QAPair.Answer: Methemoglobinemia is a blood disorder in which the body cannot reuse hemoglobin because it is damaged. Hemoglobin is the oxygen-carrying molecule found in red blood cells. In some cases of methemoglobinemia, the hemoglobin is unable to carry enough oxygen to body tissues.

QAPair.Question: What causes Methemoglobinemia - acquired ?
QAPair.Answer: Acquired methemoglobinemia results from exposure to certain drugs, chemicals, or foods. The condition may also be passed down through families (inherited).
